preChecks:
1) Confirm the phone number entered by the user is correct.
2) Confirm the phone number is active.
3) Confirm the phone is in a good network zone to receive the OTP.
escalationPath: If CX still does not receive OTP, raise a Zendesk / JIRA ticket. Check with the user the device type and device version (iOS / Android).

preChecks:
1) If user is unable to fetch portfolio using MF Central, user will get CAM8 and K-Fintech options to fetch their portfolio. Check if CX has fetched both CAM8 and the K-Fintech portfolio.
2) Guide the user to click on 'Get more portfolio' to get their remaining portfolio.
3) If CX has fetched from both CAM8 and K-Fintech, need to confirm if all their mutual funds are linked to the phone number shown on the screen.
4) If CX confirms the phone number is correct - Guide the user to click 'Edit' option, select CAM8 and click Confirm. Once updated, click 'Get my portfolio' again and enter OTP.
5) If CX is still unable to fetch portfolio - Check if user's portfolio is in DEMAT format. If yes, inform: 'We are currently unable to support DEMAT funds digitally. We are working to enable DEMAT funds, once the feature is enabled, you will get it updated.'
6) If CX confirms portfolio is not in DEMAT format - Ask the user to check eligibility at: https://www.voltmoney.in/check-loan-eligibility-against-mutual-funds
7) If user has their portfolio in EL88 lock-in period - Assist the user by saying EL88 lock-in period can be fetched once the lock-in period completes.
8) If CX is still unable to fetch portfolio - Check if user has redeemed somewhere else, Check if user has pledged funds somewhere else, Check Approved Funds List.
9) If CX is still facing the issue - Ask the user to share the AMC statement to precheck:
   • Check NRI Funds
   • Verify by getting individual AMC statements from user
   • Check KYC - if done or not, Validated or not
   • Check if there is any JOINT holdings - it should be as mentioned: AS: Any or Survivor, ES: Either or Survivor, SI: Singular

Note: Double check with the customer if they have changed any of their contact details (Phone number or email) with the AMC in the past 6 months in case of Nippon fund.
escalationPath: If everything is correct and user is still facing the issue, raise a Zendesk / JIRA ticket.

2) Ask the user to retry after 30 minutes.
escalationPath: If the issue still persists, raise a Zendesk / JIRA ticket.

preChecks:
1) Cross check - the photo should match 70% with Aadhaar photo.
2) Error may be because eyes are not found - either eyes are closed or user is wearing glasses.
3) Ask the user to remove anything covering their face and try again.
4) Check whether selfie is captured in good lighting and clear plain background. If not, ask the user to capture a selfie with good lighting and clear plain background.
5) Ask the user to capture a single account holder photo - multiple faces should not be captured.
6) Ask the user to allow permissions for Volt Money app / Chrome. Enable third-party cookies / pop-ups / Redirects. Suggest user to use web to complete the process.
escalationPath: If everything is correct and user is still facing the issue, raise a Zendesk / JIRA ticket.

subType: Amount Paid but POS Not Updated in App
preChecks:
1) Paid from own account - Verify payment details and update the status.
2) Third-party Payment:
   • For DSP Users: Request the user to send an email from their registered email ID to support@voltmoney.in with supporting documents.
   • For TATA: No third-party repayment will be accepted. Ask the user to drop an email to support@voltmoney.in with bank statement and cancelled cheque.
3) Bank Transfer (Account to account) - Repayment accounting TAT is 1-2 Business days.
4) Online Banking (UPI, Debit card, Net banking) - Expected TAT: 10 mins within Business Hours.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk Ticket if TAT is crossed.

subType: Amount Paid on X Date but Accounted on Y Date
preChecks:
Check repayment timing:
1) Paid after 6 PM - Inform that amount paid after 6 PM will be accounted for next day.
2) Check if accounted in SOA - Verify bounce charges and penal charges in SOA.
3) Not accounted in SOA:
   a) Status Requested - Amount will be automatically refunded if confirmation is delayed. TAT: T+7 Business days.
   b) Status Success with Lender, Recon failed.
   c) Status Collection Complete.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk / JIRA ticket if issue persists after TAT is crossed.

preChecks:
1) Ask the user to try using the web interface.
2) Ask the user to try using the mobile app.
escalationPath: If error persists, get screenshot and raise Zendesk / JIRA ticket.

preChecks:
This can happen due to an issue with the user's bank / mode of payment.
• For DSP & TATA: Refund TAT is 5-7 business days.
• If payment was completed by the user but not processed in 24 hours, inform the user as a failure repayment.
• The refund will be processed within 5 working days as per product policy.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk / JIRA ticket if the repayment amount is not refunded to the user's bank account and TAT is crossed.

preChecks:
1) Pending Credit Approval - Check credit approval status and inform the user.
2) Withdrawal Amount less than Available Limit - Inform the user about minimum withdrawal amount.
For pending credit approval, ask the user to wait for 2-3 hours. If issue persists after TAT, raise Zendesk / JIRA ticket.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk / JIRA ticket if TAT is crossed.

subType: Unable to Place Withdrawal Request (Option Grayed Out)
preChecks:
Check application status:
1) Status Completed - Lodgement Delayed: Check lodgement status and inform the user.
2) Status In Progress - Account Opening Delayed: Wait for 2 hours TAT, then raise ticket if needed.
3) Status Completed - Account Opening Completed: If withdrawal amount is reversed and not credited to user's account, Appsmith status will be automatically updated as failed.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk Ticket.

subType: Amount Not Received in Bank Account
preChecks:
Check Disbursal Status in Appsmith:
1) Status Queued - Check expected completion tab.
2) Status Approved - Check expected completion tab.
3) Status Settled - Check expected completion tab.
4) Status Lender API Failure - Raise ticket if TAT crossed.
5) Status Rejected - Check disbursalStatusRemarks for 'Pending on checker approval'.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk Ticket. For TATA: Get user consent and raise ticket for manual disbursement.

preChecks:

2) Check if there is any accrued interest pending.
3) Check if there is any excess amount to get settled.
If credit sub-status is closed, raise a ticket to OPS team to confirm the reason.
escalationPath: Raise Zendesk / JIRA ticket if nothing is pending.
